attributes.action: Backdate the Police Pay Deal from Sept 1st
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The Home Secretary has deemed it appropriate not to backdate the Police Pay deal to September 1st, instead starting the increase from December 1st.  This equates to only a 1.9% rise, not the 2.5% quoted.  Taking into account inflation, Officers are on a daily basis, putting their lives on the line for an actual cut in pay.  The decision not to backdate has meant that the average officer will be around £200 worse off from the September to December period.
